meanings.definition: To adjust or adapt to a new climate or environment.
meanings.sent1: She acclimatises quickly to the cold weather by wearing a warm coat.
meanings.sent2: The plants acclimatises to the sunny garden after being indoors.
meanings.sent3: The penguin acclimatises to the tropical island and starts sunbathing.
meanings.sent4: Like a chameleon, he acclimatises to any situation effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: Her body acclimatises to the high altitude, allowing her to climb the mountain.

meanings.definition: To become accustomed to a new situation or condition.
meanings.sent1: He acclimatises to the noisy city life after living in the quiet countryside.
meanings.sent2: The puppy acclimatises to its new home and starts exploring the backyard.
meanings.sent3: The robot acclimatises to its programming and starts performing tasks efficiently.
meanings.sent4: Her mind acclimatises to the idea of change, embracing new opportunities.
meanings.sent5: The athlete acclimatises to the pressure of competition, improving with each race.
